SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Energy Drinks relative to the peak of Bottled Water in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Energy Drinks is to the {right} of the peak of Bottled Water.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Bottled Water show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Bottled Water shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Soft Drinks} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =86618.2?
EVJ.A: At X =86618.2,the label with the highest density is {Energy Drinks}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 48245? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Bottled Water or Energy Drinks?
NC.A: {Energy Drinks} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Soft Drinks or Kombucha?
NC.A: {Kombucha} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {1} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Soft Drinks}
